meanings.definition: Uglies: unattractive or unpleasant in appearance
meanings.sent1: The old, torn curtains looked really uglies in the room.
meanings.sent2: She thought the muddy puddle was so uglies.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt at a serious face ended up looking quite uglies.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had an eerie, uglies vibe to it.
meanings.sent5: The rotten fruit emitted an overpowering, uglies smell.

meanings.definition: Uglies: to make or become unattractive or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: The rain started to uglies the once beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the cake out too long will uglies it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to uglies the garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter weather can quickly uglies the roads.
meanings.sent5: His negative comments began to uglies the mood of the party.

meanings.definition: Uglies: a person or thing that is unattractive or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was known in town as the uglies.
meanings.sent2: She always avoided sitting next to the class bullies, the uglies of the school.
meanings.sent3: The old, broken-down car was affectionately referred to as 'the uglies' by the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent4: The dark storm clouds gathered above like a looming uglies.
meanings.sent5: The monster in the movie was the ultimate uglies, scaring everyone in the audience.
